args.content:
import Mathlib

/--
If f : X → Y is surjective and X is a metric space, then the quotient topology on Y induced by f
arises from a pseudo-metric on Y (hence from a metric on the quotient of Y by the relation of
being at distance zero). We state the existence of a PseudoMetricSpace structure on Y whose
induced topology equals the coinduced (quotient) topology from X.
-/
theorem quotient_topology_is_pseudometrizable (X Y : Type*) [MetricSpace X]
  (f : X → Y) (hf : Surjective f) :
  ∃ m : PseudoMetricSpace Y,
    UniformSpace.toTopologicalSpace (@PseudoMetricSpace.toUniformSpace Y m) =
      TopologicalSpace.coinduced f (UniformSpace.toTopologicalSpace (@PseudoMetricSpace.toUniformSpace X (MetricSpace.toPseudoMetricSpace))) := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

theorem quotient_topology_is_pseudometrizable {X Y : Type*} [MetricSpace X] (f : X → Y) (hf : Surjective f) :
  ∃ (m : PseudoMetricSpace Y),
    @UniformSpace.toTopologicalSpace Y (@PseudoMetricSpace.toUniformSpace Y m) =
      TopologicalSpace.coinduced f (@UniformSpace.toTopologicalSpace X (@PseudoMetricSpace.toUniformSpace X (MetricSpace.toPseudoMetricSpace))) := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

universe u v

theorem quotient_topology_is_pseudometrizable {X : Type u} {Y : Type v} [MetricSpace X]
  (f : X → Y) (hf : Function.Surjective f) :
  ∃ (m : PseudoMetricSpace Y),
    (UniformSpace.toTopologicalSpace (@PseudoMetricSpace.toUniformSpace Y m)) =
      TopologicalSpace.coinduced f (UniformSpace.toTopologicalSpace (@PseudoMetricSpace.toUniformSpace X (MetricSpace.toPseudoMetricSpace))) := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

universe u v

theorem quotient_topology_is_pseudometrizable {X : Type u} {Y : Type v} [MetricSpace X]
  (f : X → Y) (hf : Function.Surjective f) :
  ∃ (m : PseudoMetricSpace Y),
    @UniformSpace.toTopologicalSpace Y (@PseudoMetricSpace.toUniformSpace Y m) =
      TopologicalSpace.coinduced f (@UniformSpace.toTopologicalSpace X (@PseudoMetricSpace.toUniformSpace X (MetricSpace.toPseudoMetricSpace))) := by
  sorry
